description: See how Haverford compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Haverford
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Haverford - The New York Times
text:
Haverford, Pennsylvania
The median family income of a student from Haverford is $168,700, and 67% come from the top 20 percent. About 1.8% of students at Haverford came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how Haverford compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
